# JUDICIARY-CLASS E.R.V
[color=#a4885c]Ship Size:[/color] Medium
[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 1-3
[color=#a4885c]Power Gen Type:[/color] Antimatter Engine (AME)
[color=#a4885c]Expeditions:[/color] All
[color=#a4885c]IFF Console:[/color] None
"Judiciary-class Expeditionary Research Vessels are refitted Research hulls from a past era of galactic civil war. They are armed and armored, but are not the best choice for ship-to-ship combat. They instead excel with their manufacturing capability and personnel armament."
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the Antimatter Engine (AME) generator is functional (View below.) - Check that the SMES unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the substation unit is charging. - Check that the Engineering/Research APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check that the Server Room/Atmos APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check that the Bridge APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on.
## 1.2. Antimatter Engine (AME) reactor unit.
- Check that the AME control device is anchored to the floor and connected to a 3x3 containment shielding structure. - Check that the AME control device is connected to the cable terminal of your SMES via HV. - Check the fuel remaining of the generator unit. - Enable Injection. (Note: AMEs automatically generate power equivalent to demand.)
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Check that both air canisters are anchored to their respective connector ports. - Check that outgoing distribution air pump is ON. (This may require removal of covering catwalk with WIRECUTTERS.)
## 2.2. Waste Loop
- Enable external waste loop pump. (Located outside of server room.)
## 3. Other checks
- Check that both gyroscopes are anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled.
## Sidenotes
* - Judiciary-class vessels have an isolated server room contained within a vacuum. In order to access Telecomms, the Gunnery server, or the Research server, EVA is required.
* - Notably, due to refit specifications, the AME has little armor and is a significant weak spot during combat. However, it is also on the side of the vessel with the most external weapons.
* - Totaling combined APC wattage can appraise the rough power requirements of the vessel. Base power consumption is approximately 24kw, more if running shields, fabricating, moving or firing weapons.
